Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This unique opportunity is part of JPL's Mechanical Systems Engineering, Fabrication and Test Division that engages in research, technology development, and the creation of advanced mechanical, thermal, propulsion, and electronic packaging systems with expertise that spans the full breath of mechanical subject areas and is applied from architectural concept development through operations.

As a Mechanical Engineer II, you will be working for the Payload and Small Spacecraft Mechanical Engineering Section (355), which is responsible for the structures, mechanisms, and mechanical systems engineering of payloads and small spacecraft across all phases of the mission lifecycle. In this role, you will:

  • Support mechanical engineering activities for payloads, instruments, and small spacecraft during mission phases including proposal, concept/system architecture development, detailed design/analysis, and production build/assembly.

  • Perform as a Mechanical Design Engineer for JPL on a spacecraft, instrument or robotic project.

  • Create complex CAD models, assemblies and engineering drawings for the overall system

  • Develop configuration trades on the mechanical system of a space exploration project.

  • Collaborate with space science authorities, analysts, manufacturing engineers, and project staff.

  • Perform conceptual spacecraft, instrument or robotic design for feasibility and cost estimates of future missions.

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Acoustics or related technical subject area with a minimum of 3 years of related work experience; or a Master's degree in a related technical subject area with a minimum of 1 year of related work experience or PhD in a related technical subject area .

  • Broad experience and knowledge in mechanical engineering, design, analysis, and verification of structures (spacecraft, payload, or instruments), mechanisms, or opto-mechanical assemblies. 

  • Extensive experience with the design and development of medium to large structures, deployable structures, or composite structures.

Desired Skills:

  • Broad experience and knowledge in the following areas:

    • Mechanical design of primary and secondary structures, mechanisms or optics.

    • Engineering CAD (Computer-Aided Design) tools such as Siemens NX, CATIA or Creo.

    • Creating engineering drawings using the ASME Y14.100-2017 standard.

    • Creating detail drawings, assembly drawings, interface drawings and source control drawings.

    • Geometrical dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T) using ASME Y14.5-2009.

    • Application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in solving mechanical engineering problems.

    • Adept at performing trade studies and developing conceptual configurations.

    • Aerospace fabrication processes.

    • Aerospace material selection.

    • PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) tools such as Teamcenter, Enovia or Windchill.

  • Extensive knowledge of Jet Propulsion Laboratory flight project practices and design principles, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.

  • NX version 1953 or higher CAD modeling and drawing production skills.

  • Teamcenter version 12 or higher PLM data management experience for product development

  • PLM data management experience for product development.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
